page.title: 17LONDON DOCKS
page.content: London docks were set up as a port for Roman armies over 2,000 years ago. Victoria Dock was opened in 1855 and the others followed on. In 1981 the largest docks were the Royal Victoria, Albert and King George V. But because the water was not deep enough a new port was built at Tilbury. When the London Docks closed it meant that there was a lot of people out of work and unemployment struck the London dockland. The area available is 1,000 acres of land and 235 acres of water. In 1985 new houses, and airport and many new enterprises are being built.
